alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Coastal (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 1:24PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Baldwin County through 230 PM CDT... At 123 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Bon Secour, or 5 miles south of Foley, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Foley, Magnolia Springs and Bon Secour. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
